heaviest_rainfall.status: On 04 January 2025, a record rainfall of 36.8mm was measured, indicating an exceptionally wet day.  4.6mm per hour was recorded as falling at times during the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: A torrential downpour occurred on 02 September 2025 when the rain reached a maximum intensity of 27.0mm per hour.  This happened during a 15.0 hour storm when 21.19mm of rain fell.

longest_rain.status: The longest rain storm on record lasted 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm of rain fell and at one point was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning activity recorded in a single day is 23, which occurred on 07 September 2025 (since our records began on 11 April 2025).

nearest_lightning.status: The nearest lightning strike was on 13 May 2025, at a distance of 4.97 miles.

storm.status: No storms are expected.  The last storm was observed on 16 September 2025 and continued for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no cold snap in progress.  So far, 6 cold snaps have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 3.7.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is currently no heatwaves.  This year there have been 6 heatwavess, usually there are 1.9 heatwavess per year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was 18 July 2025, there have been only 62 tropical nights since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (195°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The top recorded wind gust is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The highest wind run ever seen is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The largest wind speed ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 2.4°C) and outside temperature (down 1.7°C).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 359 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 653 m), feels like temperature (down 1.6°C), and dew point temperature (down 1.8°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 359.1m lower than yesterday, 27.1m lower than the past week, 653.2m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 702m to a maximum of 2980m, averaging 1238.6m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 1265.7m and 1891.8m respectively.
cloud levels.summary: The sky may alternate between sunny and overcast.

summary.summary: Inside; comfortable and pleasant temperatures. Outside; mild temperatures are expected. Also, pleasant humidity levels and little or no wind. Drizzle or light rain possible, the sky may alternate between sunny and overcast, and bright intervals likely. Changeable conditions.
